Eezo

Installation

There's a couple of ways to get Eezo running, there's the classic method of downloading a css file and including, or the more advanced Bower method.

Download a bundle

Perhaps the simplest way to get Eezo running is to download and include one of the bundles from Github. There's a few options, listed below.

Bundle Name Size Download
Core
The basic bundle for Eezo, containing the most common css compositions, no extra weight.
7.65kb Core
Core +
The basic bundle for Eezo, plus some extra features...
8.77kb Core +

Install with Bower

bower install --save eezo

Installing with bower opens up the possibility of customising Eezo's default options, allowing complete control over the different components. 

/* import eezo as .scss for complete control */
@import "./bower_components/eezo/src/eezo";
 
/* or just include a bundle from the dist folder */
@import "./bower_components/eezo/dist/eezo-core";
